answers.answer: Landa, if you've got stones following a GB removal, you've got to be treated. It can and has happened to others. You're risking pancreatitis and liver issues if you don't get treatment. Get to a good GI doc and figure out what you need to do to get the condition treated.

question: I have been in a tremendous amount of pain for the last two months.   I had  my gallbladder removed but have been told that I have stones in my pancreas.  Has this happend to anyone else. I can't eat or sleep.  I also have diabetes and high blood pressure.  Very scared about this.
title: Stone attacks after gallbladder removal
